titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Maria Edgeworth Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday November 29, 2018 at 04:24
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Collection includes Bertha Coolidge Slade's collection of Edgeworth materials, including correspondence between Edgeworth and Richard Bentley and others; copies of letters by Edgeworth, including correspondence with Rachel Mordacai Lazarus and John Murray; letters by Richard Lovell Edgeworth; holograph poem entitled "Enigma"; drawing of Edgeworth's Library by F. W. Fairholt; and Slade's research files, gathered during research for her book, "Maria Edgeworth, 1767-1849, a Bibliographical Tribute," which consist of correspondence with rare book and manuscript dealers including Michael Sadleir, and notes about various editions of Edgeworth's writings.
Also included is original Edgeworth material from other sources, including correspondence with Anna Letitia Barbauld and others; letters by Richard Lovell Edgeworth; several engravings of Edgeworth; and an undated corrected typescript by E. G. Ewens entitled "Maria Edgeworth: A Study."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Source information is recorded in series level notes. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Maria Edgeworth Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Maria Edgeworth Collection. General Collection. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscripts Catalog. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. This finding aid will be updated periodically to account for new materials that may be added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been added since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Maria Edgeworth, acquired by the library from a variety of sources. Materials incorporated into the collection prior to February 1998 have been organized into two series. Series I, Bertha Coolidge Slade Gift
, consists of original correspondence and documents by Edgeworth and others, and copies of Edgeworth correspondence; Mrs. Slade's research files on books and articles by Maria and Richard Lovell Edgeworth, including descriptions of various editions; correspondence between Mrs. Slade and various rare book and manuscript dealers, including notes, invoices and descriptions of Edgeworth material; and correspondence between Mrs. Slade and various other people, primarily concerning her Edgeworth collection. Series II, Materials from Other Sources
, consists of original Edgeworth material acquired from various other sources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter of 1835 discusses American and English proverbs and encloses an engraving designed by Frances Anna (Beaufort) Edgeworth to illustrate Miss Edgeworth's The Bracelets , published in her Parent's Assistant . Letter of 1837 mentions her Harry and Lucy and The Dame School Holiday ; published in BCS's Maria Edgeworth, 1767-1849, A Bibliograph- ical Tribute , London [1937], p. 4
